comments.body: afaik `let` and `const` are included under another patch, is there a really good reason to have them here? (Also, I thought those worked without strict?)
--harmony_classes implies --harmony_scoping.  The check is to ensure that the the latter is still on.  I believe let/const in sloppy mode is still under development.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@eval('"use strict"; class C {}');  // Should not throw.
eval('"use strict"; let x = 42');  // Should not throw.
eval('"use strict"; const y = 42');  // Should not throw.

// Verify that the --harmony_classes flag unlocks classes again.
